characters: I SHOULDA HAD MY TUBES TIED

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: The screen is black. Thunder rumbles.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (VO)
dialogues.text: When you hear thunder... A black bowling ball pulls away from the lens. The ball i the hands of THEO SKINNER, an intense, handsome 28 year o man with sideburns dressed in worn bowling attire.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (VO)
dialogues.text: ...God is bowling. He holds the ball in front of him, wristbrace on, his fac study in concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty causeway spans a bay somewhere along the south s of Long Island. The sky is overcast. SHEILA, a woman in h late twenties, wearing a full length heliotrope pleather over a waitress outfit, kneels in the middle of the road. souped-up Vespa motor scooter stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: KEN AND BARBIE
dialogues.text: Sheila holds a Bridal Barbie and Ken doll set. She sets t down on the road, pulls out a can of lighter fluid and so the dolls. She pulls out a bowling pin-shaped lighter and torches the nuptial tableau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo drives his ratty old American car along a highway. T car has Ohio plates. He sucks coffee from a 7-Eleven "Big Swig" cup and examines a map. A yellow plastic "Bowler on Board" sign is stuck to a side window. Theo's music PLAYS His eyes nod off, then snap awake.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTMARE
dialogues.text: The screen is black, except for three circles in the midd of the screen. The light shining through them is snuffed by three large pink objects. There is a loud POP, like a thumb being pulled out of a tight hole.

dialogues.speaker: BOWLING BALL
dialogues.text: A slow motion low tracking shot of a bowling ball hitting a polished lane.

dialogues.speaker: BOWLING PINS
dialogues.text: Close-up of the milky white surface of two bowling pins on opposite sides of the lane - a seven-ten split. The RUMBLING ball is heard in the distance like a furious hulking steamroller of doom. The pins begin to tremble, and then transform into a Bridal Ken and Barbie. The dolls burst into flame.

dialogues.speaker: BALL
dialogues.text: The ball blasts past the camera and metamorphoses into Theo's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo's sedan blasts past the camera down the empty road.

dialogues.speaker: BURNING DOLLS
dialogues.text: The flaming couple stand in the middle of the bridge. Theo's car hits the pair and they fly into the air in slow-motion. A distant SOUND of pins scattering is heard. The two dolls smoke as they spin into the sky, then hit the water with dual HISSES.

dialogues.speaker: PIN RESET MACHINERY
dialogues.text: An American Machine and Foundry pin reset machine perform its functions like a mechanical ballet as the camera foll a bowling ball through its journey. The "Spare Me!" theme MUSIC (similar to "Balboa Blue" by the Marketts) swells. TITLE: SPARE ME! appears on the bowling ball. Pins tumble across the back plate, are loaded into the pin conveyor, lifted up to the crown feeder, distributed into the rotat carousel, and then set down in perfect formation upon the polished bowling alley. BURN-IN PRINCIPAL PLAYER TITLES. Titles appear on the pin The ball trundles along the return trough straight into t lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muzak cover of 'Broke, Busted, and Disgusted' PLAYS in background as Theo gingerly pulls a hot taco out of the microwave oven. ALFIE, the rickety old man who runs the store, shuffles up to the self-serve island and begins wi it down. Theo pokes at the taco with a spork as steam ris He pulls a disgusted grimace. Alfie pours himself a cup o coffee and then attempts to open a tiny container of half half. Because his hands are shaking so much, the cream go everywhere but into the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: I'm an addict. I can't go through a day without the stuff. Theo reaches over and pours for him with a steady hand.

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: You're not from around here, are you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm from Akron. Alfie looks at Theo's bowling shoe attired feet.

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: You a bowler? Theo's hand starts shaking uncontrollably. He puts down t cream.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a man.

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: What kind of man?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: A bowler. Alfie presses a matchbook into Theo's hand and then trund off. Theo looks down at the matchbook; it reads "Bowl for health, enjoy yourself. Babylon Lanes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo pulls into the empty parking lot of Babylon Lanes be a cheap looking American sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo walks into an empty run-down forty lane bowling alle carrying his ball bag. It is dark. The fluorescent lights switch on and the pin re-set machines whirr into action. and BREEZE, two shady looking guys in a basement-sale sui walk up lane dividers towards Theo.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Lane's closed big fellah, league night.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm not here to bowl.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Theo's bag) You drag that coconut around for your health, or do you know how to use it?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (bristling at the challenge) I'm looking for somebody.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Hey, ain't I seen you on the tour?

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: No, pinhead, he ain't here to bowl.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Buzz Fazeli. Sid and Breeze look sideways at each other.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Fazeli...I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: What do you want with old man Faz?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Some unfinished business.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: If you wanna do business in this town, there's other people around here got more weight than old Faz. A lady dwarf walks by.

dialogues.speaker: DWARF
dialogues.text: Evening Sid, evening Breeze.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Evening Tina.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Good luck tonight Tina. Tina opens a door and goes down some stairs.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You guys got something going on downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: We provide some extracurricular activities for the senior citizens in the community.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Basement bingo? Breeze sniggers into his hand

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (smirks) Yeah, basement bingo.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Lemme see your ball. Breeze grabs Theo's bag.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Let go of my bag. Sid sidles around behind Theo who tries to keep him in si

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Ah, come on, lemme see your ball.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: You afraid we're gonna steal it? Breeze unzips the bag and pulls the ball out. Theo's temp is rising, he breathes deeply. He is obviously making a Herculean effort to keep himself in check.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I said, let go of my bag. With lightning speed Theo's hand shoots out and grabs the middle fingers on Sid's right hand. Sid howls in agony.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Aagh! Stop! Those are my bowling fingers!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Tell your little pal to let go.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Breeze, give him his ball back! Breeze, astonished, drops Theo's ball into the bag. Sid cringes in front of Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Where can I find Buzz Fazeli?

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Whoa, cool your maples. Over the bridge, past the Peter Pan, last house on the dead end. Theo releases Sid's hand. Sid drops to his knees and cradles his damaged hand.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Haven't seen a ball like that since '69.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It belonged to my dad. Theo turns and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNIOR, a dumpy man in his late thirties with a rat tail, skin and wearing a white straitjacket and fluorescent ora pants, runs desperately through dark woods. Bloodhounds B in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo drives over the draw-bridge and past the Peter Pan D with its huge neon sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo's car pulls up in front of a modest suburban house. rooftop weather vane in the shape of a bowler CREAKS ominously in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo rings the doorbell. The porch light comes on, and MILLIE, a fifty-five year-old woman dressed for a night o the town in Reno, but with fuzzy slippers and a hairnet, opens the door. A miniscule neurotic poodle leaps at Theo bowling ball bag, YAPPING and snapping at it.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Is Mr. Fazeli in please?

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: Who wants to know? (to dog) Zeus!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm a bowler.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: I'm sick of you people. Why don't you leave him be?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (OS)
dialogues.text: Let him in, Millie. And don't frisk him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie and Theo, with Zeus hot on his trail, enter the ro BUZZ FAZELI, a sixty-five year-old man shaped a lot like compressed bowling pin, slouches in a recliner. The room decorated with trophies of Buzz's bygone pro-bowling halc days.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: Oh sure. Let everyone in. From now on I leave the door wide open. Let the parade begin!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Clam it! Millie is silent. Buzz gets up and approaches Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Hey, rat. C'mere. Zeus growls at Buzz as he comes nearer, then clamps onto sleeve and hangs from his arm, growling ferociously. In o smooth motion, Buzz flings the rabid poodle through an op window and into the night.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: Jerk. She heads outside.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sit down. Theo sits on the edge of the couch. Buzz puts out his han Theo shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Buzz Fazeli.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Theo.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I know your face, you're an up-and-comer. You bowl on the tour.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm not on the tour this year.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (nods understandingly) Need some advice, huh.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Fazeli, the Bowling Congress says I'm a thorn in their side.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (dismissive wave) Don't worry about the Congress, they're just a bunch of moralistic busy-bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie's furry slippers protrude from the driver's side d Zeus chews furiously on the yellow plastic 'Bowler On Boa sign. She rifles through the contents of the overstuffed glove compartment. She notices her dog.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Get that outta your mouth!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They suspended me.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Why'd they suspend you? Theo's eyes glaze over, the lights in the room dim, and B seems to recede into the far distance.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: In ultra-slow scan we see an image of two bowlers, one is smiling cockily to off-screen fans and waving, the other Theo, his face filled with hate, winding up to smash the other man in the head with his bowling ball.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (VO)
dialogues.text: It wasn't really my fault. In the far background the hollow booming VOICE of a judge delivers sentence.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE, (VO)
dialogues.text: The American Bowling Congress hereby suspends Theo Maynard Skinner from all professional bowling activities within the jurisdiction of the American Bowling Congress and its international co- signers... The ball mashes into the smirking mans head, causing it to snap forward. The judge's gavel BANGS and the crowd ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo snaps out of it, the room lights come up, and Buzz l in.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I got suspended when I was young, too. I was pretty cocky in my day.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They suspended me for 100 years.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 100 years! (knits his brow)

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I can appeal in five. I was hoping you could help me Mr. Fazeli.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (uneasy) What do you think I can do?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (sweating slightly) I need a sponsor to get my sanction card back. Where I come from, you're the king.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sure, around here, any fat old bald guy could be king. I'm nothing. It wouldn't do any good for me to talk to the Congress. (briskly changing subject) Hey, you thirsty? You like orange whips?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I've never had orange whips, I'm from Akron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie and Buzz are in the kitchen, talking in loud whisp Millie fills a blender while Buzz cuts oranges.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: He's the guy Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: He's not the guy, Millie. Just whip the whips.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: I looked in his car. He's got pictures of you, clippings, maps.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Bowlers don't go around killing other bowlers. He's only a fan, Millie. I'll give him some tips and an autograph and he's outta here.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: You're in trouble, aren't you Buzz? You're doing something dangerous in that alley.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Millie, I know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: We should leave this town. I can't take this anymore. I'm not gonna let him kill you in my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz rejoins Theo in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Remember the finals in Akron in '59? You had a seven-ten split in the final frame.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, against that prick VanDeMark.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Ten thousand to one, but you pegged it. The toughest shot on the last frame.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: That game was before you was born.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: My mom was there. She told me about it. The 'Fazeli Split.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blender is wailing at high speed as Millie throws in whole box of laxative, a can of Drano and a jar of pills. hands are trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie walks into the living room with a silver tray hold two orange whips; one thick and deadly, the other thin an safe. There is laughter coming from both men.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: And the irony is, thirty years later, that prick is bowling in the seniors on TV all over the world, and look at me. Ah well. The docs made me stop, on account of my ticker. (taps his chest) I don't really miss it, but then... (chokes up) ...I miss it. He spies Millie approaching with the tray.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Orange whip, nectar of the bowling gods. Thanks sweetie. Millie turns the tray so that Buzz takes the untainted whip.  Theo takes the other glass.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Zeus is on the sofa, GROWLING and tugging at Theo's bowling bag. The bag rips apart and the ball hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ORANGE WHIP
dialogues.text: Theo brings the drink to his lips. The ball rolls across the room.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: The ball rolls into Buzz's feet.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: This your lucky bullet? Buzz picks it up and reads the writing on the ball. He sn a look into the kitchen, seeing the empty Drano and laxat cartons. Buzz slams the drink away from Theo's lips. The drink explodes across the room. Buzz is up on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (with intensity) Where'd you get this ball?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (stunned - looks at the mess on the floor, then at Buzz) It's mine.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Who gave it to you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Grace Skinner.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (astonished) Grace Skinner. Who's Grace Skinner to you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: She's my mom. Theo stands and takes the ball from Buzz's hands. Buzz is shock, staring at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (regaining his voice) Who are you? Who sent you here?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm your son. You're a hard father to find.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: Son?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (to Millie) Millie, please. (to Theo) I don't have a son. I think you better leave now young man. Buzz gestures towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (calmly) Grace Skinner Fazeli, you must remember her? Buzz takes Theo by the elbow to eject him from the house.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I don't know no Grace Skinner.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (pulls his arm away) You knew her. You married her in 1963.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: Married? Buzz grabs a large bowling trophy and waves it at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You're a bullshit artist, that's what you are. You got no right to be here! Theo yanks the trophy away from Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I got a right. You're my father.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I ain't nobody's father! Theo hurls the trophy at Buzz. He ducks and the trophy sa into a large glass trophy case. Broken glass and trophies everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: (noticing Zeus)

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Zeus is laid out cold near the spilled orange whip on the living room floor. Millie hunches over her comatose poodl

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: My poor baby!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (to Theo) You see what you did? (he picks up the ball) Take your ball and get out. Theo takes the ball and exits the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo, bathed in sweat, practices his release form with obsessive determination. He is alone near the empty bridg Sheila spies on him from behind the bridge control booth. Theo takes a long slug from a bottle of liquor. He hears motor scooter start and ROAR off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo stands at the self-serve island sipping coffee. A mu cover of 'Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head' PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (resignedly) 99 years, 241 days, (looks at his watch) 15 hours, and 20 minutes of no bowling. Alfie shuffles up to the self-serve island and begins wiping it down.

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: Find your bowler?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it didn't go so good. He wasn't the man I thought he'd be. Theo is trying to affix the lid on his cup, but his hands are trembling, spilling some of the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: My father used to say to me "Never..." no, hmmm. "Always..." No, no... (puzzles) Ah! Love and hate are blood relations.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Maybe I should have left the ball in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie kneels on the front lawn patting dirt down on a li grave marked by a wooden cross. Theo walks up.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: He's not here.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about Zeus, Millie.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: (points to grave) This is a sign! Someone's coming to take Buzz away from me. I don't know if you're the guy or what, but I'm not letting it happen. I'm leaving him first.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I couldn't kill Buzz. I need his help. Theo helps Millie load suitcases into the trunk of her car.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: Buzz Fazeli never helps anybody but himself.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He's my father, Millie.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: He's no father to you. Theo lifts a box full of new bowling pins into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: Careful with that one. He won't tell me anything, but I know there's something strange going on over at the lanes. If you ask me, I'd say the old fart wants to die.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Where can I find him?

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: (looks at her watch) The Peter Pan. Millie gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: You tell Buzz I went to my sister's in Ronkonkoma. Oh, I'm sorry about trying to kill you last night, Theo. It was nothing personal. Millie puts on a pair of sunglasses and patches out in a cloud of gravel and dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blender WHIRRS. Sheila, in her waitress uniform, carefu chops something. She watches an indoor motocross rally on the diner's colo TV. 12-PACK, a hefty construction worker, sits at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: 12-PACK
dialogues.text: Hey Sheila, how's that orange whip comin'?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (mimicking him under her breath) How's that orange whip comin'? THWAP! Sheila is dismembering a Ken doll with a big knife She scoops the parts into the blender and switches from p to frappВЋ.

dialogues.speaker: 12-PACK
dialogues.text: So, I heard Junior busted out again? Sheila puts the glass down in front of 12-Pack with a THU

dialogues.speaker: 12-PACK
dialogues.text: Hey Sheila, you can whip my oranges anytime. Sheila puts a Barbie head earring on her left ear. Buzz comes into the diner and slides into a booth. Sheila walks over with a pot of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Cup of joe Mr. Fazeli?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, and make it extra muddy, I didn't sleep a zee last night. Sheila fills a cup. Buzz lifts it to his mouth, his hands trembling.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You don't need coffee, Mr. Fazeli; you need a vacation. Sheila catches sight of Theo pulling into the parking lot. She puts a Ken head earring in her right ear. Buzz follows Sheila's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (groans) Some people will do anything for an autograph. Theo enters the diner and walks over to Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Millie left to stay with her sister in Ronkonkoma.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You know what a mixer ball is? It's like you, you come out of nowhere and upset things, scattering everything all over. Buzz grumpily waves at him to sit.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What are you doing over at the lanes that's so dangerous, Buzz?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You shouldn't listen to her, she's a nervous old Nellie.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: She thinks someone's trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I couldn't pay someone enough to try to kill me. Sheila comes over to take their orders.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I'll have my usual please, Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Buzz Burger, side of 'cues. You haven't introduced me to your fan.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sheila, meet...uh... (leans in to Theo, sardonically) I forget the name.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (uncomfortably) Theo.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Theo! This is Sheila Kastle, my partner's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (eyeing Theo up and down) You look like you're something on the lanes.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Theo's bowled on the tour.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Oh, a professional man. What'll you have?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What's your specialty?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Whips...orange whips.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Then I'll have the number four with one of your finest whips.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: How do you want it? (their eyes meet) The eggs.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (discomfited at the blatant double entendre) Uh...over easy.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Coming right up. Sheila smiles and walks away. Theo watches her slink behi the counter.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Watch out for that one. She's got a great average, but she's looking for a prince. And, believe me, she's (more)

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: kissed a lotta tadpoles. (looking Theo in the eye) Listen, I been thinking about your problem. I'm not the guy to sponsor you. It would be unethical. But, there is something I could do for you. (leans in, secretively) Putt-putt golf.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Putt-putt golf? Buzz pulls a golf ball from his pocket, flashes it and sl it back.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: It's the next level, the next dimension... (deep conviction) ...the small ball.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (in Buzz's spell) The small ball.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: It's gonna be bigger than big. Think Europe. Think Asia. They don't have room for real golf courses in Japan.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (snapping out of it) Not for me. Miniature golf's for pansies.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: If the Japanese are pansies, then pansies are my kind of people. Sheila steps over to the booth with their food. The Buzz Burger has three holes cut in the middle to make it look like a bowling ball. Buzz sees the two sleazeballs park their car and walk towards the diner.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (pondering the thought) Maybe I could bowl in Japan. Buzz stands up abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I gotta wash up. Buzz heads for the rest rooms. The door opens with a JING

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Three whips. To go.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: When you get a chance. Sid and Breeze walk over to Theo's booth and slide in. Si middle fingers are taped to an aluminum splint. The BLEND kicks into action. Buzz watches the group from the bathro hall and tries to catch the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Hey, you still here?

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: We're looking for Buzz Fazeli, seen him?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Look Sid, a Buzz Burger. The Faz's favorite lunch. Sid reaches for the plate. Buzz walks over to the booth  and pulls his burger away from Sid.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Get away from that burger.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Sorry Faz, we didn't know you was here.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Buzz, Mr. Kastle wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (to Theo and Buzz) Are you guys bruddas? The booth party is silent for a moment. Theo LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: No, we ain't brothers.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: You know why we call him Breeze? Sid puts a hand near Breezes left ear and blows into Bree right ear. He makes fluttering motions with his hand as i wind was hitting it. Breeze's face breaks into a smile as pushes Sid away.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Hey, cut it out Sid, that tickles. I'm serious! You guys are related, right?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He's my dad. Buzz flashes a warning glare to Theo. Sid grabs some of Buzz's french fries.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (slapping his hand) Get your own.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: See that, toldja Sid. I knew I seen a resemblance.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Why don't you clowns get your whips and get lost.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Look, Faz, Mr. Kastle was not his usual charismatic self today when he told us to tell you... (gazing artfully upwards and rubbing his chin) What was that he said...?

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: I remember, Sid! Mr. Kastle says he don't like no sticky fingers in the till.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Pinhead! Don't just blurt it right out. Sheila comes over and PLUNKS down the three whips-to-go.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (to Sheila) Your pop said to put these on his tab. Sid gets up and jerks his thumb towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: So Buzz, let's skedaddle. Mr. Kastle is waiting. As Buzz gets up, Theo rises and steps between his father and the two sleazeballs.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm coming with you. Sid shies away from Theo, protecting his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Easy. I got business to do, Theo. I'll come back and haunt you later. (drops a twenty on the table, pats Theo's cheek) Don't say I never gave you nothing. Buzz goes outside with a sleazeball on either side. Sheil takes the twenty dollar bill. Theo grabs his jacket and m for the door.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to Sheila) Do those two work for your dad or mine?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Mine, and they never tip. The sleazeballs hustle Buzz into the front seat of their and patch out.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Do you know where they're taking him?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Yeah, Babylon. Buzz runs the lanes there for my dad. Everybody who has anything to do with bowling in this town answers to my dad. Theo splits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior is running at breakneck speed through the thick br Bloodhounds BARK. Junior slows down and drops to his knee gasping for breath. He looks up to the sky. The camera pu up to his sweaty, tortured face.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (shrieks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILES KASTLE lounges in a cheap chair behind Buzz's desk toying with one of those motorized wire balancing sculptu they have in airport souvenir concessions. He is a carefu groomed middle-aged low-budget version of Hugh Hefner in acrylic sweatsuit with 'Miles 'O' Lanes' embroidered on t front. Sid and Breeze push Buzz into the room. Buzz is po faced.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Buzz. Buzz nods.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (to Breeze) You got my whip? Breeze pulls the third whip out of a bag and gives it to

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (motions to Sid and Breeze) Lose yourselves. Sid and Breeze leave the room. Buzz goes to a locker and begins changing into a flashy MC outfit.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What's on your mind, Miles?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: We've been partners a long time now, haven't we Buzz?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Seven years. Kastle pokes a straw into the whip and takes a long drag.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: This scam we got going here was your (more)

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: brainstorm, Buzz. I admit, I thought it was a rotten idea, but I put up the scratch. (pulls a smile) And now we got a beautiful thing.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful thing.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: A beautiful thing. And you know why Buzz? You know what we got? Buzz raises an eyebrow as he buttons his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: We got balance. Kastle flicks the little wire man. It bobs and sways.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: A partnership is a very delicate balance. But let's say something tips the scales, maybe one partner takes more than his share, then... Kastle tips the wire man off his perch. The little motor squeals pathetically.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: ... oops. We got no more balance. Buzz looks on with narrowed eyes as he adjusts his cravat

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: And look at that; both partners go down together. Kastle shoves the sculpture onto the floor, stands up, and crushes it under his heel. He goes over and puts his arm around Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Simple math, Buzz. (he holds up his fingers) Two plus two does not equal three.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Miles, I've always been on the square with you.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I'm sure you have Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Wish me luck. Buzz jogs out into a spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Break a leg... (sneers) ...partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE erupts as Buzz appears in the spotlight. The dwa bowling alley is a pungently smoke-filled room peopled wi shady, washed-up bowlers sitting in chairs behind a bowli lane. The old-timers are shouting and pounding shots.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (over the PA) Greetings, ladies, gentlemen. (the place grows silent) My dentist told me this one the other day: How many bowlers does it take to screw in a lightbulb?

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: It takes three bowlers to screw in a lightbulb. One to hold the bulb, one to turn the ladder, and one to hold their balls. Thank you, thank you. Just throw money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo drives through the full parking lot of Babylon Lanes pulls around the back and sees dark figures slip into a b door. He parks his car, walks over to the now closed door It's locked. Theo finds another entrance and sneaks in. H creeps his way through the darkened alley towards the sou of raucous partying.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (OS)
dialogues.text: Welcome to Buzz Fazeli's Dwarf Bowling, folks, where we bring you the finest in specialized bowling entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a crack in a door Theo can see Buzz standing in the spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I would like to draw your attention to the top of the lane. (a Casio drum roll PLAYS) Weighing in at sixty-nine pounds and standing exactly three feet - the diminutive dominatrix Teeny Weenie Tina the Terrible! The crowd CHEERS as the spotlight moves to Tina, a masked lady dwarf duded up in a combination black leather and cowhide western style S&M outfit. She CRACKS a whip and leers at the bowlers. They HOWL with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Don't be shy, folks! Tina straps into her customized skateboard. A drunken customer forks over a wad of bills, steps up and grabs ho of the mini-human projectile.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: And - bowl 'er! Tina is hurled head-first towards the pins. The crowd goe wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera tracks low behind Tina as she crashes into the pins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo sneaks into an empty bathroom. He hears voices and d into a stall. Sid and Breeze shove Buzz into the room.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Seems to me like you ain't got much choice Buzz. Sid shoves Buzz over to Breeze, Breeze shoves him back.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: You're between Miles Kastle and a hard place.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Aaay, hands off the tux! Sid checks under the stalls, sees Theo's feet and whips o the door.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: The busyboy! Sid yanks Theo out.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Get your hands off me, you moron. Theo tries to free himself from Sid's grip. He turns to B

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What's it look like to you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It looks like dwarf bowling.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Very good, busyboy.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (with intensity) Dwarf bowling's illegal.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) What are you gonna do, call the bowling police?

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Heh, heh, heh.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You said it would be unethical to help me. You call dwarf bowling ethical!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I do what I gotta do to survive.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You have no right to call yourself a bowler. Buzz slaps Theo in the face.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I'm more of a bowler than you'll ever be. I deal with my own shit. I ain't asking anyone to bail me out.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm your blood.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You wish! Theo pushes Buzz up against a stack of boxes full of new bowling pins. Sid and Breeze hover behind them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You knew she was pregnant. Buzz reaches inside a box and pulls out a pin. He waves i threateningly at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure it was me? She coulda had lotsa bowlers! Theo rushes Buzz and grabs his arm. The two men struggle for the pin.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Don't say that about my mom!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I had a career. She wanted a little bowler of her own. Sid and Breeze leap into the fray, prying the two men apart. They wrestle Theo against a wall, pressing his face into the tiles.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Fuck you and fuck bowling.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: That's a laugh. You're all strung out. You're a bowling junkie.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don't need the stinking pro-tour.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You're dead without the pro-tour, and you know it. Get him away from me. Sid and Breeze punch Theo in the face.

dialogues.speaker: DWARF BOWLING ALLEY
dialogues.text: Theo is dragged through the dwarf alley crowd. He has blo on his face. Half dazed, he looks up at all the distorted leering faces that peer down at him. The crowd cat-calls laughs at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo is thrown onto the asphalt. Sid kicks Theo.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: You shoulda taken our advice, busyboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo sits in his parked car outside the Peter Pan diner. Squinting in the bright light, he examines the cuts on hi face in the sideview mirror. He is looking scruffier. He Sheila come out of the diner, start her scooter, and pull into traffic. He follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows the Vespa at a discreet distance as Sheila dri over the bridge. The weather is windy and threatening. Thunder RUMBLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo pulls in next to Sheila's scooter under the big neon sign for Miles 'O' Lanes Bowling Center. With a huge CLAP thunder and the SOUND of falling pins, the skies release pounding downpour. 37     KEN AND BARBIE, MACRO C.U. Sheila's Vespa is parked in the handicapped space. The do are wired to the headset of the scooter. Large droplets o rain roll down their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo walks into an ultramodern eighty-lane bowling center bowling bag in hand. A huge banner reads 'Mothers and Daughters Bowl Free Tonight!' The entire place is filled with pairs of moms a their daughters - bowling away in matching bowling attire three year-old girl stands staring at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Waaaaaaaaah! A mom grabs the little girl and whisks her away. Theo sur the alley and catches sight of Sheila bowling at the far of the alley. 39     LANE, SHEILA & LUNA Sheila bowls with LUNA, a 30-ish black guy dressed in a M 'O' Lanes jumpsuit and wearing extensions in his hair. Sh prods her friend when she sees Theo.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Luna, that's the guy. I saw him do this spooky bowling rain dance on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Typical. Theo walks over. Sheila presents Theo with her ball.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Here Theo, it's the Fazeli specialty; a seven-ten split. Theo looks down the lane and sees the two pins standing.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm not here to - I can't... Sheila can't release the ball from Theo's now-paralytic g

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (knowing nod) Bowling block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle, Sid, and Breeze stare at a bank of video monitors their faces illuminated by the screens.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Think he'll bowl it?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Nah, he won't do it.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Weird, comes into alleys and doesn't bowl.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: It's not an "Alley". I hate when people call it a "Bowling Alley", it's so common! I prefer "Bowling Center".

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: What's this guy here for, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Maybe he's here to pay his last respects.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Someone gonna get kacked, boss?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: If I find out Buzz is comin' up short on dwarf bowling, it's lights out for him and pink slips for you. Sid and Breeze look sideways at each other.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I hired you rent-a-thugs to keep tabs on the Faz. I want you all over him like a tent. Find out how that little weasel's ripping me off. Buzz Fazeli's gonna blow the lid off dwarf bowling! 41     LANE, SHEILA & THEO The two of them sit together behind the lanes.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I came here to have a word with your dad.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What do you want with my dad?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Business.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Won't your father help you with that?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Having a legend for a dad isn't all it's cracked up to be.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Your dad's one of the only nice people in this fucking town. My Dad is slime. Kastle walks over. Theo stands up and shakes Kastle's proffered hand.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: So you're Buzz's boy. I've been expecting you. You hurt my feelings when you didn't come and see me sooner.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Nobody sticks a finger into a bowling ball in this town without Miles Kastle knowing about it. You don't mind if I have a word with Theo, do you bunny? Kastle takes Theo by the elbow and pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I heard you've been having a little trouble with the Congress. (waves at a mother/daughter couple) Theo pulls his eyes off Sheila. Kastle walks Theo past pairs of bowlers.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You might say I'm at the top of their shit list.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help you. (calling to a young bowler) Try a lighter ball, Penelope - you'll get hurt with that big ball, honey. (to Theo) I've seen tapes of you bowling on the circuit. You got Fazeli blood running through you. Your pop was a genuine talent in his day.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What's with the bad air between you two, Mr. Kastle?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (dismissive gesture) It's nothing, just a slight business imbalance. (to a seated mother) How's Gloria's thumb?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (OC)
dialogues.text: The blister's worse than last week.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: No pain, no gain! Keep trying the ice. Chin up, sweetie. (turning to Theo) This place is a bowling oasis.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It's very...clean. They pause and Kastle waves to some bowlers.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. JACKSON, (OC)
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr.Kastle.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Hello, Violet. How's my favorite 'bowlerina' doing?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: You keep that up Carmelita and one day you'll be a champion just like Mr. Skinner here. What do you think, Theo? Think Carmelita's got the stuff?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: That's some pinfall. Almost a 133 average. Her ball's flat, she needs to work on her spin control.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: That's right, didn't you have a slight control problem in a recent tournament,champ? (to Carmelita) Now go take out your "big four", darling. (to Theo) Come on, we're making her nervous. They continue walking.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I get them while they're young. Builds loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. JACKSON, (OC)
dialogues.text: She hit it, Mr. Kastle!

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (waving over his shoulder) Four or five years when a girl like that's bowling on the pro tour for Team Kastle, she'll pay a handsome profit on my investment.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: And the dwarf bowling? They stop, and Kastle pulls Theo over to an enormous aqua near the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (making sweeping gesture) Think of this business like a big aquarium. You gotta have some sharks to eat the dirt at the bottom so the guppies can swim free at the top. (more)

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Profits down there, philanthropy up here. (looks at Theo) Besides, it beats the pants off bingo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Nice set-up.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: If it springs a leak, it'll be because Buzz is making waves.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What if he wants to get out?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (chuckles) He's earned an early retirement. (sprays his mouth with Binaca) But enough about losers; Buzz Fazeli is history. Lets talk about your future. (puts his arm around Theo) I wanna show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle and Theo stand in front of the huge bank of video screens.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Rac. R-A-C. Renovate, Automate, Computerize. That, my boy, is the future. One of the monitors shows a little girl bowling. Her ball moves so slowly it barely tips over the first pin. Kastle hits a key and the pins explode in an emphatic strike. The little girl jumps with joy.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What ever happened to just bowling?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: There's a lot of competition for amusement out there. You gotta adapt to survive.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I like the sport the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: A guy like you could breathe some fire into bowling. You got ambition like a...like a...blowtorch. You go for what you want and anything that gets in your way - PSSSHHT! -  shish kebabs. (puts his arm around Theo) Maybe lady fate washed you up on my doorstep for your own good. (pauses for effect) I think I could help you, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (he's been waiting for this) How Mr. Kastle?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: You need a sponsor; I have influence. I could sponsor you.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Why would you help me?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I like you, Theo. You bowl with soul. Kastle turns to his video screens.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: But, now that you mention it, you could afford me one minor dispensation. Theo follows his gaze to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: While you're in town, I need you to keep an eye on my daughter for a couple of days. Her big brother broke out of the mental hospital... Theo's eyes glaze over, the lights in the office dim, and Kastle seems to recede into the far distance.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTMARE
dialogues.text: As running FOOTSTEPS are heard, the camera whizzes down a darkened alley towards the pins.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE, (OS)
dialogues.text: ...and I want someone watching out for Sheila while he's, uh, loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heels of Junior's running feet.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE, (OS)
dialogues.text: Junior's a problem child. He has a thing about -

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (wails)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo snaps out of it, the room lights come up, and Kastle points to her image on the TV screen. Sheila turns and lo up at the video camera. Theo and Sheila's eyes seem to me Theo freezes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I could do that. As the two men shake hands, Sheila "flips the bird" to th camera.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: One thing, (pointing to Theo's mid- section) keep the meat in the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo and Sheila blast along the dark roadway on her Vespa Theo sitting behind Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (shouting above the engine) This is a vicious cycle.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I think that a motorbike is one of the last really free things that people can do.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Isn't this technically a scooter?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: When I'm on my bike I feel like a wild person. (she looks sideways at Theo) Better than any sex I've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Kinda tough on the butt.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Everything has it's drawbacks.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Where did your brother escape from?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: The mental hospital.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What does he do?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: He follows me, he tries to have sex with me, and then they send him to the nut-hut for a while and then he gets out and then he follows me, he tries to have sex with me, they send him to the nut-hut for a while...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: It's a vicious cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila and Theo motor across an empty beach parking field towards a lone station wagon. Swing-a-delic MUSIC drifts the parked vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila pulls up beside the wagon. She leads Theo towards group of partying people at the tailgate of the car; thre white women, three white men and Luna. Luna pulls a rubbe hookah hose out of his mouth and offers it to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Hookah?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No thanks, I don't hookah.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Theo, you ever do the 'Swing'? Theo shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: These guys all work at the alley, too. This is John, Susan, Jon, Suzanne, Jonathan, and Sue. Everyone welcomes Theo and Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: (screams) Dance Break! Luna throws himself into a wild body-whip as the music TH massively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luna and Sheila do a wild jitterbug-derived Swing-a-Delic dance surrounded by weaving white folk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the guys is on crutches, has a neck brace, a chest cast, and one arm in a truss. He stands by the barbecue a flips burgers with his one free hand. Theo walks over to

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Hey man, howyadoin'? He wiggles his hand out of the end of his cast. Theo shak his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Cool!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Theo. Howzitgoin.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey man, welcome to our parking lot. Lemme give you some advice, if she asks you to dance, make sure her brother's not around. Somebody blew out Junior's pilot light, if you get my meaning.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I was doing the lambada with her and the guy freaks, he breaks my arm, tries to kill me. I swear man, the guy thought I was a piВ–ata. If nobody else hadn't a been there, he wouldn't have stopped. He woulda killed me. Fuckin' guy man, just snapped. How do you like your burger?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (meets eyes with Sheila) Uh...over easy.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (throws a blackened burger on Theo's styrofoam plate) I'll tell you one thing, you won't see me around that alley with that freak on the loose. Stay away from his ass - and don't play any of his fuckin' knock-knock jokes. Luna comes over to Theo and grabs him. They start to danc

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Sheila wants me to show you a few steps before you two swing-a-delic.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (uneasily) So, you're the pinman around here?

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: ...And one, and two, and yes, I am. But no one gets them working like Junior used to...and two, and one.. - they call him The 'Quasimodo of the lanes.' He's the best pinman there is.. and one and two...People used to say he got the machines working so well 'cause he lubricated them with blood...and two, and one...but people just love saying things about Junior.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Mind if I cut in?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo pulls out his resin bag, powders up his hands, and g for Sheila. Theo and Sheila get low and nasty on the tarm Sheila turns and does the freak to Theo, rubbing her rear into his crotch. As Theo and Sheila dance over near John makes a throat slitting gesture across his neck. Theo's h leave white prints on Sheila's butt. The Swing-a-delic fu so hard it causes spontaneous audience dance riots and structural damage in theaters across the country.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You and your sideburns are the talk of the party, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: The ladies in Akron call them thigh- ticklers.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something personal?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'd rather you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Do you have a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Not while I'm in training.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Do you have a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (surprised) No. Do You?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: No. Not at the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila and Theo toast marshmallows over the barbecue as t rest of the party dances in the background.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: So this brother of yours is hazardous to the health of your dates?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Nobody in this town really understands Junior. When I went to family sessions for him I realized he was the sanest one in the family. Actually, he's the only one in this whole fucking town who knows exactly who he is and what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Unfortunately what he wants is you.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: So, what about you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Do I want you?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: We'll get into that later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Kastle stares at the bank of video monitors and ru battery powered fuzzball remover around his collar. The monitors are deserted. Miles absently pans a camera over then sits bolt upright. On the screen he can see Buzz Faz in a room at Babylon Lanes, surrounded by large piles of cash, stuffing rolls of bills into hollow bowling pins.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (with rising anger) Why that filthy, slimey, double-crossing, misbegotten, two-faced, mangy, son-of-a- bitch bastard! The motor in the fuzz ball remover SHRIEKS as Miles squee it to death. It shatters in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo and Sheila lie on the roof of the station wagon. "De With The Blue Dress" by Shorty Long plays on the stereo. rest of the party throws marshmallows at each other in th distance.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Theo, what would you do if you couldn't bowl?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's all I ever wanted to do.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I wanted to be a motocross champion. My folks didn't really care what I did. Then Junior blew a fuse and I became their last hope. Most girls get ballet stuffed down their throats, I got bowling. I never understood how anyone could take it so seriously. I hope I'm not insulting you.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No, I'm fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Why were you suspended?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I used to be kind of wild. They used to call me the bad boy of bowling.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: So you're hoping Buzz can get you re- instated?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Well, that was plan A.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What's plan B?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Plan B is your dad.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What do you think my dad's gonna do for you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He said he'd sponsor me.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Ha! And what do you have to do for him?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Oh really? Nothing? My dad doesn't do anything unless there's something in it for him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He asked me to keep an eye on you for a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What? Be my body guard? (she laughs) Here's my body, Theo. Guard it. For my dad's sake. For your career. Sheila starts to unbutton her bowling shirt.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Sheila, please.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Come on Theo, what about plan C?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (looking worried) What's plan C?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Plan C... (opens her shirt, showing off her brassiere) ...is me. Sheila takes Theo's nervous hands and places them inside shirt.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (torn) Look, Sheila, I really like you but... Sheila rolls on top of him, and plants a hickey on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (stopping her) Forget it, Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle hurries through the darkened bowling alley. He sto short as a warning alarm begins to sound from somewhere d within the building. Lane six lights up and comes to life Kastle walks slowly forward.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Junior? Is that you, Junior? Don't be afraid. Where are you? I won't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle stealthily sneaks along beside row upon row of sil pin reset machines shining a flashlight in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Come on, Junior. Everyone's waiting for you, son. The beam of light catches Junior's face. He is crouched inside the machine at lane six. Jr. His face is cut and bleeding and his straitjacket torn and filthy.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Needs lubrication. Lubrication.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: We're having a party for you, boy. Cake and shish-k-bob, just like you love. Junior cringes away from the light.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You made me hurt him! Kastle reaches into his pocket and pulls a gaudy digital wristwatch from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Look what I got for you. He holds the watch up in front of Junior. Junior looks curiously at the watch.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday Junior! The watch begins to play an electronic version of "Raindr Keep Falling On My Head." Junior's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Ooooooohhh. Kastle begins luring Junior out of machine number six wit the watch.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I have someone for you to play with Junior.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Someone wants to play with me?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I have someone for you to play Blueface with Junior.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Blueface! Blueface is my favorite. 51     EXT. ROAD, SID & BREEZE'S CAR - DAY Breeze and Sid speed down a road in their damaged hulk. T TENOR of Enrico Caruso can be heard from inside. 51     INT. SID & BREEZE'S CAR Breeze drives. Sid gazes out the window. Enrico Caruso WA from the car stereo.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Bowling used to be so pure, so...All- American. Breeze sings along with Caruso and pretends to conduct.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: La da da dalala...

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (looking heatedly disturbed) I hate fuckin' opera.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: How could you hate opera, Sid? Opera has all the drama and excitement of real life - to music!

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: How do you know, you don't even speak Latin?

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: You listen to the feelings, not the words.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: You got an 8-track tape player on purpose, just 'cause you knew the only thing they had on 8-track was fuckin' opera.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: It was a clearance. Sid seems to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (wistfully) You know, Elvis bowled.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: No kiddin'.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Bowling was the most incorruptible sport. No megalomillionaires, no (more)

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: gambling. And it was a safe place for kids, a place where the whole community could meet for some wholesome, clean fun.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (sympathetically) Sure, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (becoming rabid) But not no more. Now people take advantage. Bowling ain't what it used to be. There's something evil spreading in this sport - like a big, gigantic, puss- ridden -

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (getting excited) - canker sore.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (apoplectic) Right, eating at the core, eating it's way out. It makes me sick! Sid starts pressing buttons on the tape deck

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: How do you turn this thing off?

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Wait! That's an aria! Sid and Breeze struggle for the cassette. The music DISTO into a warbling gurgle of an aria.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Gimme that! Sid yanks the cassette out, but the tape becomes tangled the player. He pulls at the endless yards of tape and thr the whole mess out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo, wearing sunglasses and dressed in a jogging suit similar to Miles Kastle's, steps out of the diner with a containing four orange whips. He goes over to his parked Buzz walks up.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (in deadly serious) Theo, I want you to get out of this town.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm getting to like it here.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Did that porcupine say he'd get you back on the tour?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I gotta survive.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) He'll be a barnacle on your ass the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You got a better offer?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I didn't think so. Theo takes a long drag from his orange whip.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Not for somebody who hit a man with his ball on national television.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (bitterly) That's right, Buzz, and you know when I did it? Last match, last frame. All I needed was one spare for the crown - and I get stuck with the seven-ten, the Fazeli Split.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You never even took the shot. You couldn't do it. Theo moves towards Buzz in a threatening manner.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (repressed fury in his voice) I was beaten on a shot named after my own dad. The moment passes. Theo turns and climbs into his car. He looks up at Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Look, kid, gimme a break. I'm an old man. (taps chest) I'm runnin' on a Delrin aorta. I'm finished - dead from my ankles up.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I couldn't care less. Theo starts his car.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You know what I think? You didn't come here to find a father. You didn't even come here for help. You just came here to take it all out on somebody. it ain't gonna be me! Theo pulls out of the parking lot. yells after him.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (at the top of his lungs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kastle home is a huge nouveau riche Brady Bunch style house with a large deck jutting over the driveway. The do are open on the spacious two car garage. Sheila has the headset of her Vespa disassembled. Theo wa up the driveway, orange whips in hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I don't think your new outfit suits you, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (flicking dust off the suit) Really? I kinda like it. He sits nearby.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Do you talk with your mom?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It's been awhile. She didn't want me looking for my dad.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: My mom told me not to stay in this town.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: So why do you stay?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I'm a credit card junkie. I went on a binge and my dad bailed me out. Now I'm trapped in his easy payment plan.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I bet you get to meet a lot of eligible bowlers.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Yeah, but they're all little wannabes. I'm looking for a professional man.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (he ponders the thought) I may not be a pro bowler, but I'm no amateur man. Sheila moves closer to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (touches his lips) How much would you charge me for the lips?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: More than you could afford.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Come on, bargain with me.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I could let them go for ten.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (she pulls away, slightly) You professional men drive a hard bargain. I'm afraid I only have five on me. Sheila pulls out a 5 dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (smiles) If you want a professional man, you have to be willing to pay for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila and Theo stand on the deck. Sheila scans the road leading to the house with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What are you going to do about your brother?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You're here.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What about the guy he put in the body cast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road is empty

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Momentary relapse. Except for that, he's been making progress. Sheila laughs. Theo nervously pulls his collar up over the hickey on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Junior is like a faithful doggy. He loves his birthday so much, that every year, before we can go pick him up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle's car appears, driving hell-for- leather towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: ...he breaks out of the hospital and comes home on his own. Here they come. She hands the binoculars to Theo, who immediately trains them on the road.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: My mom once had an affair. When my dad found out, he had Junior kill the man. The body was never found, but I think Junior took him to the alley. Theo lowers the binoculars and looks at Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Then it's true, isn't it? About...

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: ...lane six. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle's car comes belly-flopping to a stop in front of t house. Kastle climbs out and gesticulates wildly to the couple.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (a loud whisper) He's here! Come on down!

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE, (OS)
dialogues.text: (muffled) OK, hats on everybody. SOUNDS of the group gathering outside can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (OS)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Dad, this is ridiculous. Just open it.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE, (OS)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Ssssh! Now real quiet. On three. One...two...three! The lid flies up and Kastle, Sheila, and Theo stand there with party hats and party horns in their mouths. They all cheer and throw confetti.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Surprise! Kastle takes a flash snapshot. Junior, lying on some fold blankets in the trunk, looks at his family with a stunned expression. He is in a straitjacket. Junior's new watch begins to PLAY "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head". He struggles to pull his arm out, but can't. Kastle reaches to untie the straitjacket.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Steady boy, steady. Untied, Junior presses the BEEPING watch against his ear. face breaks into a beatific smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle pulls shish kebab chunks off a skewer. He looks do to see that one of the chunks is a melted Ken head. He th it away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I bet you didn't know that you and Junior have something in common, Theo: Junior can't bowl anymore either. Isn't that right Junior? Kastle SLAMS the ketchup bottle down on Junior's right hand. The table settings jump from the shock. Junior sits impassively, his face a blank.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: See! No feeling. Tell Theo what happened to your hand, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: After we eat, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: He stuck it in the ball return machine when he was a kid. Crushed all the nerve endings. Junior starts stroking the ketchup bottle with his dead hand.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: It's not so bad. When I'm alone, it feels like someone else. Sheila grabs the bottle from Junior, opens it and pours some on her shish kebab. She leans over and whispers furiously to her father.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Do you have to get your hooks into every guy I'm interested in?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (whispers back, defensively) You're just like you mother! Always jealous!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: That's why Mom ran away, because you had to control everything!

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: She ran away to be with that... (spits out his words) that Motocross champion.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Your turn, Theo. Why can't you bowl? Sheila and Kastle sit up.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don't like to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You're prone to violent outbursts, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It depends.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: It feels good to let it out, doesn't it? Sheila leans over and whispers furiously to her father.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You're using Theo for your own deviant purposes!

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Look who's talking!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Just because your mother signed part ownership of the lanes over to you, doesn't mean you have a right to tell me how to run my business! I can have my lawyers take that deed away from you like that. (snaps his fingers) Sheila and Kastle sit up.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Junior, how 'bout a riddle?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (turns to Sheila) Sheila. Knock-knock. Sheila glances nervously at Theo.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Come on Sheila, knock-knock.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Junior.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Junior who?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: J'you-and-your-friend do it yet? (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Fantastic! What talent.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (caustically) You still got the touch Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bowling pin-shaped cake with candles ablaze is presente a seated Junior. He is wearing a paper birthday hat. The orange whips are arrayed around the table.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Make a wish, son. Junior stares into Sheila's eyes for several seconds.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Same wish as last year. Sheila blows out the candles in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: It won't come true, Junior. Kastle places a gift-wrapped box in front of Junior and l the lid. He reaches in and pulls out a huge, intricate cl like arm-shaped device made of plastic and metal and cove with cables.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: It's a bowling claw. You can bowl now, Junior. With the whole family. Junior beams at the group.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (puts one arm around Junior and one on Theo) Pretty soon everybody can bowl! The two sleazeballs walk up onto the deck and over to the table.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Hello Mr. Kastle. (nods to seated party) Junior, long time. I thought they locked you up and threw away the warden!

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Is it true they blacked out the whole county giving you electro-shock? Junior looks from one man to the other, breathing heavily, his nostrils flaring.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Knock, knock.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Who's...

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Don't do it Breeze! (to Junior) You ain't getting us into that. Kastle gets up.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Hey, enough fun and games. We have work to do. Come on Junior. Kastle heads for his car. Junior gets up and follows. The two sleazeballs tarry as Theo stands.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (to Theo) If Junior thinks you're doing the bouncy- bouncy with his sister, he's gonna tap dance on your spleen. (pokes Theo in the side)

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (pulls down Theo's collar to reveal the hickey) With cleats. The two men turn, laughing, and follow Kastle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kastle huddles with Sid and Breeze, Jr. stands nearby fiddling with his new bowling arm.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Buzz has been moving the cash out in hollow bowling pins. Sid and Breeze throw sideways glances at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I want you two to pick up Buzz and bring him to lane six. Junior will take it from there.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (perks up at mention of lane six) I'm gonna play Blue Face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz checks if the coast is clear and then stuffs boxes o bowling pins into the trunk of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo and Kastle stand on the deck watching the sleazeball put Junior into the trunk of their car. Kastle lights an oversized cigar and hands one to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Champ, as soon as you get back on the tour, we should do an instructional videotape. 'RAMBOWL' Theo Skinner teaches Power Bowling. You on the cover with a flame thrower. Kastle lights Theo's cigar and they puff away.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Theo, how would you like to be my new partner?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You already have a partner Mr. Kastle. Sheila walks over as the sleazeballs' car pulls out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: I think Buzz is retiring soon. In fact, I think he's retiring tonight. Kastle pulls out a shiny gold credit card and holds it in front of Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Here, Bunny. Why don't you two go and do something fun tonight, on me. Sheila is lured to the scent of the plastic like a junkie to a fix.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: One thing, stay away from the lanes. If Junior sees you two together, he'll swallow his tongue. She reaches for the card and Kastle snatches it away from her with a chortle.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Don't go near the bowling alley.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (enunciating clearly) Bowling "Center"! Kastle hands her the card and heads into the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: It wouldn't bother you if Buzz was in danger, would it?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Nope, I couldn't care less.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I'm sure you wouldn't care if he needed your help, right?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Why should I help that old fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Yeah, what did Buzz Fazeli ever do for you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Zip.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: And besides, it's probably too late, anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (exhaling cigar smoke) Way too late. Buzz Fazeli is history. (goes to take another drag, then stops) Too late for what? She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Too late for what, Sheila?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You know how people with broken bones know when there's a storm coming?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You got any broken bones?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: No, but something's gonna blow in this town. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Are you fucking with me Sheila? Is something gonna happen to Buzz? Sheila seems to be trying to tell Theo, but is unable.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (faltering) I can't tell you, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I saw your eyes when you hit that guy with your ball on TV. THUNDER rumbles. Theo takes Sheila by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (gently) Tell me, Sheila. What are you afraid of? Sheila shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you'll hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It's Junior, isn't it.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
