dialogues.text: (starting to cry) I can't - I can't do it. (she looks up through her tears at Theo) He's my brother.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He's my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and Breeze's car sits in front of Buzz's house. 8-tra opera PLAYS on the car stereo. A man screams and glass smashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. shot running desperately through the house, knocki things over, smashing things. We HEAR Buzz screaming in terror. The scream is cut off. With a THUD, the camera fa over and hits the floor. The golf ball rolls slowly into view, and stops. Footsteps recede, a door slams, and a ca drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo and Sheila walk her Vespa up to the darkened alley. is wearing his own clothes again. The SOUND of a lone bow is heard. Theo straps on his wristbrace. Sheila pulls out keys.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: These open the back door. Don't let him catch you behind the machines; if he does, you're trapped. I'll meet you at the bridge. Theo takes the keys. Sheila grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this. We could just cut out of here, go to Akron,  or anywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (dislodging her hand gently) I'll be at the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo snakes his way along the rows of pin machines, towar the only light source - lane six. As he leans in to peer through the machine, a ball EXPLODES into the pins. Junio wearing his elaborate bowling claw, is working himself in sweaty froth. Junior picks up his ball and sends it CRASH into the pins.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Knock-knock.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (stops and looks around) Who's there? Theo remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (getting angry) Who's there!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Buzz Fazeli.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: NO. I SAY KNOCK-KNOCK! You say who's there. I say who's there and then you say who who. You're not playing right. (primly) Knock-knock.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Who's there? Junior walks towards Theo.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Junior. Theo remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (boiling) You're supposed to say JUNIOR WHO! I'm going to have to hurt you. Theo and Junior circle one another.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You shouldn't touch her.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No, Junior, you shouldn't touch her.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Nobody touches her. Except me. I touch her. Sheila told me you played bouncy- bouncy with her.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What did your dad tell you to do to Buzz? Theo scrambles up the lane on hands and knees. Junior catches him, grabbing his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: He told me to play Blue-Face with Buzz. I like games.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (struggling to get away) What did you do to Buzz?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You played bouncy-bouncy with Sheila, so I'm gonna play Blue-Face with you. (he grabs Theo's throat)

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) I don't want to play. Theo stretches to get a nearby ball, but just can't reach by millimeters.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: To play, I press my fingers on a throat like this... (he presses tighter on Theo's windpipe) ...and then the mans face would go blue and I should keep pressing... (Theo's face goes pale blue) ...and I did and then he stopped moving and he didn't play anymore after that. Theo bends back a finger on Junior's hand. Junior lets out a HOWL of pain and releases Theo's neck. Theo GASPS for air.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You didn't play fair. (stands up) You were almost blue. Theo gets his fingers in a bowling ball and brings it up bash Junior in the head.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Go ahead Theo, I saw you on TV. I'm your biggest fan. Junior offers Theo his unprotected head.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (yelling) Come on Theo, GIVE ME YOUR AUTOGRAPH! Theo bashes Junior in the head with the ball. It bounces Junior's head like a Nerf ball and rolls down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Skinner! Thank you! Theo desperately, but fruitlessly tries to get away. As h crawls over the ball return trough, Junior puts his foot Theo's head.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I can have her,you know. (looks around and whispers) She's not my real sister. (he flashes a lecherous smile) THEO'S POV A ball pops up at the far end of the return and TRUNDLES rapidly towards Theo. The ball hits Theo's face with a POW. BLACK OUT We HEAR "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head." THEO'S BOWLING SHOE ATTIRED FEET Being dragged down the lane. Theo comes to and looks down his body to see the empty lane. He looks up to see Junior pulling him towards the pin reset machine. The cut on Theo's forehead bleeds down the side of his face.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (muttering) Lubrication.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE NUMBER 6
dialogues.text: Junior pulls the dazed Theo into the pin-reset machine an positions him under the pins. As Junior prepares the machinery, a control cable on his claw becomes fouled. Ju begins to thrash about as he tries to disentangle himself his malfunctioning arm. Theo rolls away as Junior's flail releases the machine. It comes slamming down on Junior ju as Theo slips out of harm's way. He gets up and staggers from the machine. Junior's HOWL echoes across the lanes. twitching feet protrude from the maw of the device. Lane goes dark. Theo limps up the lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo drives up to the erect draw-bridge. He stops and get out. The night is silent.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Sheila! Where are you? Sheila pops out of the bushes and walks towards Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (angry) You told Junior that we did it.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: It?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It. Bouncy-bouncy. Fucked. He tried to squeeze my fucking head off. What did you say to him? When they reach each other, they stop. Sheila seems to weigh her answer.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I told him you were my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (very pissed off) What the hell did you go doing that for Sheila? We haven't even gotten naked yet!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: We would have sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Oh great! He tried to kill me! You knew he would go off if he thought I fooled around with you.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Did you - kill him? Theo paces up and down in front of the upright bridge.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: How do you get this thing down?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened Theo. Theo backs Sheila towards the bridge control booth.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (glares at Sheila) You wanted me to kill him, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (in shock) If he's not dead, he'll keep coming back.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He's dead Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I feel sick.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Are you sure he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I didn't stop to take his pulse. Theo boosts Sheila up the ladder to the control booth. Th hydraulic machinery of the bridge heaves into motion and bridge begins to lower. Theo walks over to his car. Sheil jumps down from the bridge control booth and follows him.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I think your brother may have already gotten to Buzz. He gets into his car.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Can I come with you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I did your dirty work for you Sheila, now fuck off. Theo drives away leaving Sheila standing alone. She watches his car recede with a thoughtful expression, then turns on her heel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo grips the steering wheel with white knuckles. He nod off at the wheel, the roadway through his eyes wavering a distorting. He hits himself in the face in an effort to k himself awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is dark except for a light coming from the clos bathroom door. Theo cautiously makes his way to the door.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (whispers) Buzz? You alright? WATER is running inside. Theo twists the doorknob and ope the door with a jolt. Junior lunges out of the dark, mang and bloody with bowling pins sticking out of his chest.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Don't you KNOCK? Theo SLAMS the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo jerks awake. His car is parked by the Fazeli house. is a clear, blustery day. A gust of wind pulls the screen door open, then SLAMS it shut. He gets out of the car and walks unsteadily towards house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo walks into the house. The place is completely trashe Theo picks up a golf ball from the floor. He makes his wa the bathroom door and slowly turns the knob; then pulls b He picks up a nearby bowling ball and holds it over his h as he reaches for the doorknob. This time, he thrusts the door open. The bathroom is empty. Relieved, he cradles th ball in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: BALL
dialogues.text: Thick crimson red fluid trickles down his forearm, dripping off his elbow. Horrified, he pulls his fingers out of the ball. Blood streams out of the three finger holes. He drops the ball to the floor. He goes into the bathroom and turns on the sink faucets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water runs as Theo manically washes the blood from his ha and arms. He rinses the blood from the holes of his ball looks up to the mirror. "NOK NOK" is smeared in blood acr his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo waits through several rings.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Hello, mom?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Theodore? Where are you? Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I found dad.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: He's dead, isn't he. (pauses) Buzz Fazeli might just as well have died before you were born.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Mom, you know I had to do it. I just did it a little too late.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You sure you're OK Teddy? You're not bowling are you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Love ya mom. Theo hangs up the phone. Alfie shuffles over.

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: Did you hear about that bowler who got smeared? I saw them pull a body bag out of the alley. I heard he was kacked but good. They had to take apart the pin machine to get him out.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (stunned) The pin machine?

dialogues.speaker: ALFIE
dialogues.text: Just like Junior did the last time; lane six. All's I know is it's gonna be a closed coffin. My advice to you is to lay low. He puts on a pair of dark 7-Eleven shades, flips up his collar and skulks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo pulls into the parking lot. The place is cordoned of with day-glo yellow emergency tape printed with "Bowling Police - Do Not Cross". A black bowling police van, its b light spinning, is parked in front. Bowling cops herd dwa and customers into the van. Mothers and daughters mill ar behind the yellow tape. A group of little people brandish "Right to Work" signs. Theo gets out of his car. The crow moves in as Kastle, hands cuffed behind him, emerges from door.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: There he is! Camera flashes POP all over the place. Two black-jacketed bowling cops step out behind him. They are Sid and Breeze

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Bowling police, step back, give him room.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Nothing going on here, everybody stand back. Let him through, ladies. Ladies, please. As they start to move through the female throng, a little girl pops out in front of them, holding her ball.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Mr. Kastle, we know you wouldn't do anything bad.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: Thank-you, sweetheart. (turns to Breeze) See that you pinheads! Character witness. (with sweeping head gesture) They're all character witnesses! (he sees Theo) Thanks to Buzz Fazeli, bowling is dead in this town! He KILLED it! The two officers hustle Kastle towards the van. Theo steps out in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (between clenched teeth) You fool, we could have done great things together!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Where's Junior?

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: He killed your stoolie embezzler father, and he's gonna kill you next! Sid and Breeze push him towards the van as the crowd's MURMUR increases. Kastle turns and yells over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KASTLE
dialogues.text: (shouting) Lock your daughters up, ladies! Junior's out there! Mothers and daughters send out a cacophony of screams and scatter for their cars. The BP cops hoist Kastle into the back of the van. Sid slams the doors shut. The van screeches off, sirens wailing. Sid and Breeze walk up to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Sorry about your loss.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I should've pegged you guys for bowling dicks from day one.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: You should probably hit the road. Go home. This place could get hazardous for your health.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: So, Buzz was stooling for you guys.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: You call it stooling, we call it cooperating. Breeze looks under Theo's car.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Did you know you were parked in the handicap space?

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Kastle's daughter's been lookin' for you. Theo gets into his car and starts the engine. Sid and Bre poke their heads in the windows.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: She told us you went after Junior to save your old man's hide. You got some balls goin' after that psycho.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Only problem is, you didn't put his lights out, you just got him mad. Then he took it out on poor Faz, God rest his soul. Theo patches out.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Think he bought it?

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: I'd buy it! Sid chews his lip worriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo nods off for a second and then snaps back. His eyes hypnotized by the lines on the road which seem to swim an undulate unnaturally. He nods again. And snaps again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo pulls up to the old party spot and gets out. He walk over the dunes and towards the beached station wagon. A h flame rises down the beach. A woman is visible in its lig tossing objects into the fire. Theo walks towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila is stripping Barbie and Ken dolls and tossing them onto the pyre. Each one goes up in an exaggerated  WHOOSH flames. She notices Theo when he steps into the light.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Once my father walked in on me while I was making Barbie and Ken do it. He freaked. I was seven. He took all my dolls away from me and cut them in half. He gave the top halves back to (more)

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: me. Then he made me watch him burn the bottom halves in the fireplace. Theo kneels down nearby and throws a Barbie onto the bonfire. It goes up with a WHOOSH.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I can see Junior's face in the fire. Theo puts his hand on Sheila's hand. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: When I'm with you Sheila, I don't even think about bowling. Theo takes Sheila in his arms and kisses her passionately. She stops him and looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: If Junior finds us, he'll kill us both.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I killed him once, I'll just have to kill him again.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You don't get two chances with Junior.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: At least I'll die smiling. Sheila pushes him over. He falls backwards, her on top.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: And you only get two chances with me. Sheila yanks her shirt over her head and tosses it away.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: The shirt CRACKLES and burns. She pulls Theo's head up to her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What's it gonna be, Theo? A Barbie's breasts blister from the heat. THEO & SHEILA Theo bends Sheila backwards, down on her back. She grabs the tail of his shirt, yanks it over his head and off his body. Sheila rubs her hands up Theo's back.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What's the plan, Theo? A Ken back bubbles and melts. Theo lifts Sheila's back of the sand and works her jeans down her legs.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Say something, Theo. Give me something. A doll's legs catch fire. Theo stares into Sheila's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Plan C. From now on it's gonna be plan C. Both bodies throb and grind, their sandy hands sliding over each others' sweaty skin.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It's gonna be you, Sheila. They humpty-hump to the beat of "Scientist's" 'DEMATERIALIZE.' We hear Theo and Sheila's stereophonic MOANING as a Barbie and a Ken doll collapse and vaporize the blazing heat. We pan up through the flames, the MOANS increasing in vol and intensity as they reach the you-know-what-we've-all-b waiting-for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coffin moves slowly forward as a solemn DIRGE plays. Th top is in the shape of a bowling alley with a miniature b bowling ball inscribed with "The Faz" at the head. The pallbearers; Theo, Breeze, Sid, Tina, and two other bowle place the coffin on poles above the grave. A rotund pries sprinkles holy water. Sheila stands next to Theo, crying. (more) Theo wears a glazed look. The priest clears his throat wi loud AHEM.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: (with pomp and vigor) Bowling! (pauses to reflect) Bowling is a little like faith. Every now and then, we are blessed with the ability and strength to send a full roller down.. (makes bowling gesture) ...and scatter those babies like nobody's business. And every now and then we end up in the gutter. (pauses and gets glum) Buzz Fazeli found himself in the gutter of life. Trapped in hook alley, throwing nothing balls. But before he left us for that pie alley in the clouds, he pulled himself out of that gutter. Buzz Fazeli died cleaning up the sport of bowling. Now he lies at peace alongside his lane brothers here in Bowlers' Field. (makes sign of the cross) He died so that we could bowl - with dignity. Millie, decked out in mourning black, lets out a wail, steps up and throws a bouquet of flowers onto the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: (sniffles) I forgive you Buzz. Sid leans over to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (in loud whisper) The Faz sure took care a her. (points to Millie, does the cash rub with fingers) Breeze makes a nasal GRUNT as he tries to suppress a snigger. Sid - trying to keep a straight face - elbows him. Sid and Breeze approach the coffin. Breeze pulls an orange whip out of a paper bag and carefully places it on the coffin lid.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Nectar of the bowling gods, Faz.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: See ya 'round Faz. Tina steps up to the grave with a handful of papers.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: These are all your perfect games. (she drops scoresheets onto the coffin) Bowl with God, Buzz. Mourners sniff and cry. The coffin starts descending into ground. A stiff breeze scatters the scoresheets. Sheila nudges Theo who approaches and tosses a handful of soil i the grave.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Maybe you were right Buzz. Maybe I did just come here to take it out on somebody. But, I had to find my father... The muffled BEEPING of "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head" begins playing from inside the coffin. Theo's body jolts. He runs after Sheila who is walking towards her scooter.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Buzz is alive, Sheila. The two sleazeballs gaze surreptitiously at him as they w towards their car. Theo grabs Sheila's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Theo, Buzz is dead.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I didn't come this far to bury a guy that's not my dad. He owes me.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Back to plan A. The vicious cycle all over again. Theo lets go of Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I've been trapped by Miles Kastle my whole life. She walks over to her scooter, and mounts it.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Now he's the one who's locked up and I'm the one who's free. If I gotta do this alone, I might as well start now. She revs up and peals out.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sid and Breeze walk up to their car, Theo catches up w them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Why is Junior's watch in that coffin? Something stinks around here.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Your time is up, busyboy.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Who identified the body?

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: The body was identified along proper Bowling Congress guidelines for processing a bowling related fatality.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm the next of kin. I should've seen him.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: After we ID, we bury the body. Case and casket closed.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You tried to make it look like Junior trashed his place. Junior's underground in that coffin you dicks put him in.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: It's splitsville for you. Sid and Breeze back away from Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You faked my dad's murder. You used him! Where is he! Theo chases Sid and Breeze around their car. He catches Sid and grabs the middle fingers on his right hand. Sid howls.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Ow! Ooh! No, please! Doc said I'd be back on the planks in a week! Show him Breeze! Breeze pulls a copy of "New York Bowler" from his pocket. The headline reads "RUB

dialogues.speaker: OUT
dialogues.text: KINGPIN" with a photo of Buzz Fazeli.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: It's official, you're an orphan. Happy now, busyboy? Theo stares at the newspaper. He lets Sid's fingers drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila speeds along, her Vespa maxing out at 30 mph. From behind her we see Theo's car approaching rapidly. He pull beside her.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (shouting and pointing frantically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think you know me so well that you can give me an ultimatum? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Who said anything about an ultimatum? You want to find your father? Get a shovel and start digging. Hurry up, he's probably in Purgatory by now. Sheila makes a pathetic attempt to speed away from Theo. He moves up beside her again.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You're really pissing me off.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I'm pissing you off? I'm doing what I said I'd do. What the hell are you doing? What about your word?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: My word is good, and it'll always be good. When did I ever give my word to you?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What about plan C?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Fuck plan C!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Your word is so good, you're never gonna give it to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You think I'm dumping you to get back into bowling. Well who's dumping who?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I'm not dumping you, I'm suspending you.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Sez you!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Suck my dick! She speeds ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo THUNDERS along in his car. He listens to his SONG ov the stereo. Theo digs into his pocket and pulls out the g ball from Buzz's house.

dialogues.speaker: GOLF BALL
dialogues.text: The logo on the ball reads "PARADISE."

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Paradise. The white ball fills the frame.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (OS)
dialogues.text: (whispers to himself) Paradise. Hmmmm The camera pulls back from the ball to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo standing in flowery long Bermuda shorts, matching airbrush Luau shirt and 7-11 shades. The woman behind the counter looks like Alfie's twin. (It's actually Alfie in drag.) It's the same store as before, only with a tropica motif. Instead of bowling magazines on the rack, there's Golf Digest. ALFREDA examines the ball at arm's length, through her bifocals.

dialogues.speaker: ALFREDA
dialogues.text: You a mini-golfer?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: ALFREDA
dialogues.text: Paradise, huh? Might be one of the new putt-putts off route 99. Theo turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ALFREDA
dialogues.text: Can I get you something for the road?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You have orange whips?

dialogues.speaker: ALFREDA
dialogues.text: Orange who? Not from 'round here, are ya?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No. I'm from Akron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The billboard fills the frame. It reads "Paradise Putt-Pu and underneath: "A heavenly experience." A motorized chee looking smiling dwarf-angel swings a golden club.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MINI-GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Miniature golf obstacles are bathed in the light of the setting sun. The camera passes a huge cement centaur surrounded by astro-carpeting.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: I just hold it loosely with both hands?

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: That's right, sugar, find the grip that's right for you. Then grasp firmly. The camera weaves past a five foot pink whale with a gaping green mouth leading onto a mini-green.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Grasp firmly. Then what?

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Line up where you want it.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Now swing it out a little to the right...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Like this?

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: No, no, that's too far. Try a more gentle stroke. It's all in the stroke. Go ahead, now, honey - stroke. As the camera comes around the side of the whale, we see an elderly man in a fire hydrant red sports coat and white slacks hunched over a diminutive fiftyish woman.  His back is to the camera and he is wearing a baseball cap with a plastic halo attached to it.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Strokin'. Here goes nothin'. She swings a club, sending a golf ball puttering into a c

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Hole in one! You're the queen of stroke!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Yippy! Theo strides towards the couple. The man under the halo i (more) Buzz. He raises the club at the approaching Theo, keeping woman in front of him as a shield. The front of Buzz's ca reads "I'm No Angel."

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Hi Dad.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Dad? You said you was single.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: We ain't married no more.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He says that to all his wives. As she tries to wiggle away from him, the club conks Buzz the noodle, squishing his halo.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (freeing herself - to Buzz) Geez Maynard, is he telling the truth?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Don't pay him any mind, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: You're a nice guy, Maynard, but if you got two wives - I ain't into no polybigamy. Buzz is silent. He takes the club out of her hand. She steps away - startled - then turns and jogs away. Buzz throws down his club in a fury.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Goddam it! I was just about to make a love connection. You sure got a way with women. You show up, women get away.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (laughs) The whole world thinks you're underground.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I am underground. Buzz removes his damaged cap.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It could just as easily have been me in that box.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I told you to get lost. You forced yourself into this mess, so the mess accommodated you. Buzz straightens out and carefully remolds the bent out of shape halo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What about bowling?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (takes a practice swing) Bowling died for me years ago. Besides, I'm a living dead legend. I'm a hero.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You're a scumbag. Buzz pats his hair down and slips the cap back on his hea

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I'm a live scumbag. Theo digs into his pocket and retrieves the golf ball. He tosses it to Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Nice knowing you, dad. Theo turns and walks towards his car. Buzz pauses and wal after him.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: So, eh, you never saw me. Right?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I never saw you.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Thanks, kid. (pause) Where are you goin' now?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'm goin' straight. No more short cuts. Theo gets into the car. Buzz leans in the open window.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Listen, if straight doesn't work out, you come work for me. (hands Theo his card) Just make sure nobody's following you. Buzz's face is eerily lit by the glow of the sunset, his halo bouncing in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I didn't mean that stuff I said. I was trying to keep you out of this muddle. I'm glad I didn't have my tubes tied. Oh, and by the way, I made a call for you before I - uh - retired. Buzz takes his card and scrawl on the back with a gold pen.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (hands the card back) You give Ed Klein of the American Bowling Congress a call. (taps the card) Tell him your Maynard's boy. He's expecting you, and he owes me. He'll getcha back in like Flynn. (pats Theo's cheek) Don't say I never gave you nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (cracks a half smile) See ya 'round Maynard. Buzz backs away from the car as Theo peels out in reverse Buzz stands and watches as Theo pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign has been changed to "SHEILA'S ALLEY." A sparklin new badass super-chromed Vespa is parked in the handicap zone. The Barbie and Ken dolls are wired to the headlamp. They look incredibly worse for the wear. A parking ticket nestled between them. Theo's car pulls in nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo walks through the doors and into the alley packed wi serious bowling types. As he walks towards the back of th alley, several bowlers stop bowling and stare at him in a

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Theo! Howya doin'? Theo walks on. Others greet the conquering hero.

dialogues.speaker: BOWLER
dialogues.text: Theo! Hey, Theo's back!

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Hello there, stranger.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: (still crying) Waaaaaaaaaaah! At the far end, we see Sheila, dressed in a fitted joggin suit, bowling alone on her lane. Bowlers stop and hold th balls at their sides. Sheila notices the whole alley is silent. Theo steps up to the lane, bowling ball bag in ha As he straps on his wristbrace he peers down the lane and sees a seven-ten split; mule ears.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: A loud ZIP and light spills in through three holes. Three fingers approach the holes, blocking out the light once m With a POP, the fingers leave the holes and the ball hits lane with a KLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: LANE
dialogues.text: The camera races towards the pins along the maple boards.

dialogues.speaker: PINS
dialogues.text: Two pins loom in the foreground, one at each edge of the screen. The ball slams into the right hand pin in super s motion with a ROAR. Theo's eyes slowly close. The pin lif and hurtles slowly across the frame towards its unsuspect fellow pin. Theo's eyes open. With a reverberating EXPLOS the pin is taken out. 83     INT. SHEILA'S ALLEY, THEO & SHEILA Theo turns to Sheila and takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Very professional.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I am a professional man.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (touches his lips) Lips still for sale?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (nonchalantly) You bet. For five bucks, I'll even throw in the tongue.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: (she pulls away, slightly) Can you change something this big? She pulls out a hundred dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don't know. Sheila stuffs the bill down Theo's pants.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You'll owe me. They smooch big time. One by one, balls drop to the lanes again and pins start CRASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfie, hands trembling, lays a tiny wreath on Buzz Fazeli grave. The headstone reads, "Maynard 'Buzz' Fazeli 'I Nev Met A Bowler I Didn't Like.'" A muffled watch beeper CHIM "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head." The camera pulls up show ten headstones laid out in a bowling pin set-up with Buzz's at the head.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MINI-GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Buzz's silhouette against an orange sunburst sky. He wear his halo hat. He takes a beautiful PGA-perfect slow motio fluid golf swing, connecting with a THWAP. As he follows through, divots of turf dance at his feet. MUSIC swells. holds the afterswing pose and gazes after the ball, off i the distance.
